ranking.title: Ranking
ranking.description: Ranking is a feature that shows the most active users in the PacaPaca service in order. The ranking is divided into three types: points, received carrots, and sent carrots.

due to a community guideline violation.
block_notice.dialog_description:
Your account has been temporarily restricted 
due to a community guideline violation.
block_notice.restrictions: During the restriction period, activities such as posting, commenting, and liking are limited.

notification.title: Notification
notification.permission_description:
Receive notifications about your activities on PacaPaca. 
You can receive notifications such as new comments, likes, and carrots.

guidelines.title: PacaPaca Community Guidelines
guidelines.rule1_content: Criticism, profanity, discriminatory remarks, and sexual content are prohibited. Please respect each other for comfortable conversations.
guidelines.rule2_content: Empathize with others' concerns and suggest positive solutions with a warm heart. It's important to communicate while respecting each other's feelings.
guidelines.rule3_content: Please provide positive and constructive feedback rather than criticism. Communicate with the intention of encouraging others and solving problems together.
guidelines.rule4_title: 4. Don't Ask for Personal Information or Suggest Meetings
guidelines.rule4_content: Requesting personal information or suggesting personal meetings is prohibited. Please focus on concern counseling.
guidelines.rule5_content: Please report users who violate community norms or engage in inappropriate behavior. Everyone must work together to maintain a safe and warm environment.

carrot.title: Carrot Usage Guide
carrot.intro:
What Pacappi and Pacappu love the most in the world? It's carrots! ðŸ˜†
But these aren't just any carrots! In PacaPaca, carrots are symbols of empathy and encouragement.
carrot.outro:
The more carrots we share, the warmer our community becomes.
Pacappi and Pacappu get happy when they see carrots too! ðŸ¥•
carrot.case1_content:
When you relate to someone's concern!
Say "I totally understand!" and give a carrot!

Empathy is the first step to understanding and comforting each other.
carrot.case2_content:
When you receive good advice!
Say "This advice really helped me!" and give a carrot!

Show your gratitude for helpful advice.
carrot.case3_content:
When you want to cheer someone up!
Say "I'm rooting for you!" and give a carrot!

A small encouragement can make a big difference.
